GOD.content: ethical must sometimes be refused in name of responsibility that doesn’t calculate, that keeps its secret, that tyrannically [Nietzsche], jealously refuses violence of accounts and justifications, declining autobiography that is auto-justification: egodicée
GOD.linkedContent: ethical must sometimes be refused in name of responsibility that doesn’t calculate, that keeps its secret, that tyrannically [Nietzsche], jealously refuses violence of accounts and justifications, declining autobiography that is auto-justification: egodicée

SPOM.content: the egological body, Marx cries: ghost of all ghosts! > forum, agora [cf. F], gathering place toward which specters run
SPOM.linkedContent: the egological body, Marx cries: ghost of all ghosts! > forum, agora [cf. F], gathering place toward which specters run

SPOM.content: Stirner advocates auto-affection of “I-Me,” where no ghosts can haunt, no spacing, no interstice > thinks this epokhē reduces, exorcises the ghost, Marx thinks it reduces to the ghost
SPOM.linkedContent: Stirner advocates auto-affection of “I-Me,” where no ghosts can haunt, no spacing, no interstice > thinks this epokhē reduces, exorcises the ghost, Marx thinks it reduces to the ghost

SPOM.content: acc. Marx, Stirner borrows disguises (Verkleidungen) of Hegelian idea, opposes himself to non-self, reappropriates himself as living, incarnate being
SPOM.linkedContent: acc. Marx, Stirner borrows disguises (Verkleidungen) of Hegelian idea, opposes himself to non-self, reappropriates himself as living, incarnate being

SPOM.content: “I am” = “I am haunted,” Ego = ghost; Es Spukt (translation misses impersonal, quasi-anonymity of German), “it spooks,” “it ghosts,” it specters,” ego inhabited by its own specter
SPOM.linkedContent: “I am” = “I am haunted,” Ego = ghost; Es Spukt (translation misses impersonal, quasi-anonymity of German), “it spooks,” “it ghosts,” it specters,” ego inhabited by its own specter

SPOM.content: “es spukt” in Freud’s “Das Unheimliche,” production of figure the revenant (der Spuk)
SPOM.linkedContent: “es spukt” in Freud’s “Das Unheimliche,” production of figure the revenant (der Spuk)

SPOM.content: Cartesian cogito, Kantian “I think,” phenomenological ego cogito: “a real presence is promised here to a Eucharistic Narcissus” > living being visited by its own apparition
SPOM.linkedContent: Cartesian cogito, Kantian “I think,” phenomenological ego cogito: “a real presence is promised here to a Eucharistic Narcissus” > living being visited by its own apparition

SPOM.content: phenomenological ego is a specter, phanesthai is the possibility of the specter, brings death, gives death, works at mourning [see pp. 237-38n Husserl’s noeme, irréellité]
SPOM.linkedContent: phenomenological ego is a specter, phanesthai is the possibility of the specter, brings death, gives death, works at mourning [see pp. 237-38n Husserl’s noeme, irréellité]

SPOM.content: living ego is auto-immune, welcomes other ghosts

VM.content: w/out using these terms, Levinas warns against confusing idem (same) w/ ipse (ego), identity w/ ipseity > this happens immediately w/ Greek and German: autos, selbst
VM.linkedContent: w/out using these terms, Levinas warns against confusing idem (same) w/ ipse (ego), identity w/ ipseity > this happens immediately w/ Greek and German: autos, selbst

VM.content: for Levinas, homogenization of Same and Ego, homogenized w/ concept, and finite totality, permits him to condemn state, totality, not in the name of but against subjectivity
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, homogenization of Same and Ego, homogenized w/ concept, and finite totality, permits him to condemn state, totality, not in the name of but against subjectivity

VM.content: acc. Levinas, Hegel and Kierkegaard: violent & pre-metaphysical egoisms
VM.linkedContent: acc. Levinas, Hegel and Kierkegaard: violent & pre-metaphysical egoisms

VM.content: btwn original tragedy and messianic triumph there is philosophy, in which violence returned against violence, in which original finitude appears, in which other is respected w/in, by, the same ——question of philosophy: why finitude? why must I think transcendental through ego, ipseity? ——Husserl called irreducible egoic essence of experience “archi-factuality” (Urtatsache)
VM.linkedContent: btwn original tragedy and messianic triumph there is philosophy, in which violence returned against violence, in which original finitude appears, in which other is respected w/in, by, the same ——question of philosophy: why finitude? why must I think transcendental through ego, ipseity? ——Husserl called irreducible egoic essence of experience “archi-factuality” (Urtatsache)

VM.content: for Levinas, tragedy of ego, riveted to its own being > even in transcendence toward, venturing toward, the Other
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, tragedy of ego, riveted to its own being > even in transcendence toward, venturing toward, the Other

OH.content: heading of the other: first condition of an identity that is not an egocentrism destructive of oneself and the other, not even anti-heading or decapitation
OH.linkedContent: heading of the other: first condition of an identity that is not an egocentrism destructive of oneself and the other, not even anti-heading or decapitation

F.content: Ichspaltung rethought when it is not Fetish vs. Thing (in-itself) but Fetish-Thing as cipher to be translated interminably
F.linkedContent: Ichspaltung rethought when it is not Fetish vs. Thing (in-itself) but Fetish-Thing as cipher to be translated interminably

FWT.content: how we proceed as if psychoanalysis never happened, as if we still believed in sovereign authority of ego, speak the language of “autonomy”
FWT.linkedContent: how we proceed as if psychoanalysis never happened, as if we still believed in sovereign authority of ego, speak the language of “autonomy”

DS.content: [Derrida comes back to i] reads little point as a decapitation right next to castrated pike > capital I (disseminates unity of meaning), ego, ice, écho—plus-je > (I + Dé)irisation
DS.linkedContent: [Derrida comes back to i] reads little point as a decapitation right next to castrated pike > capital I (disseminates unity of meaning), ego, ice, écho—plus-je > (I + Dé)irisation

GSP.content: Husserl: phenomenology of ego’s self-constitution coincides w/ phenomenology as a whole
GSP.linkedContent: Husserl: phenomenology of ego’s self-constitution coincides w/ phenomenology as a whole

PS.content: for Artaud, swollen ego of cock > separate from me: “a true man has no sex” [swelling of sex as castration]
PS.linkedContent: for Artaud, swollen ego of cock > separate from me: “a true man has no sex” [swelling of sex as castration]

DPi.content: Hugo: “alloy of egotism alters and destroys finest social schemes, that is the black vein in the white marble” [self-interested noble cause]
DPi.linkedContent: Hugo: “alloy of egotism alters and destroys finest social schemes, that is the black vein in the white marble” [self-interested noble cause]

AFR.content: de Biran's criticism of Condillac’s arbitrary also a criticism of rationalism, of alchemism (reduction to the gold of abstract, simple, fundamental element [ego]), of idealism
AFR.linkedContent: de Biran's criticism of Condillac’s arbitrary also a criticism of rationalism, of alchemism (reduction to the gold of abstract, simple, fundamental element [ego]), of idealism

IW.content: Fichte’s great “discovery”: ego cogito is national, Self is social, in essence a national Self, cogito not formal [Kant] but in relation to other, a history, a language, substantially national
IW.linkedContent: Fichte’s great “discovery”: ego cogito is national, Self is social, in essence a national Self, cogito not formal [Kant] but in relation to other, a history, a language, substantially national

IW.content: “I” signs first in its spiritual language
for Fichte, conversely, nation is an ego > relates to itself via egological subjectivity
IW.linkedContent: for Fichte, conversely, nation is an ego > relates to itself via egological subjectivity

IW.content: truth of nationality is German idealism; the German spirit is the spirit of humanity
IW.linkedContent: truth of nationality is German idealism; the German spirit is the spirit of humanity

IW.content: Cohen suspects a narcissistic infatuation in Fichte’s national ego, mirror of a certain psyché, but also room for any other self in this national self, cosmopolitan logic, national self as “We”
IW.linkedContent: Cohen suspects a narcissistic infatuation in Fichte’s national ego, mirror of a certain psyché, but also room for any other self in this national self, cosmopolitan logic, national self as “We”

HST.content: Levinas: memory of servitude in Egypt assembles humanity, ego is a hostage, ego ceaselessly missing itself, debt absorbed only by being increased; such is the pride of nonessence!
HST.linkedContent: Levinas: memory of servitude in Egypt assembles humanity, ego is a hostage, ego ceaselessly missing itself, debt absorbed only by being increased; such is the pride of nonessence!

LI.content: structural & essential, iterability is at work in all facts, each mark divided or multiplied in advance > a more powerful “logic”—graphics of iterability undercuts classical opposition of fact & principle (le droit), factual & possible (virtual), necessity & possibility
LI.linkedContent: structural & essential, iterability is at work in all facts, each mark divided or multiplied in advance > a more powerful “logic”—graphics of iterability undercuts classical opposition of fact & principle (le droit), factual & possible (virtual), necessity & possibility

LI.content: iterability disrupts presence, unity of ego in sender, du maintenant-écrivain (grasping w/ 1 hand his ballpoint pen) > stigmè of every mark already split
LI.linkedContent: iterability disrupts presence, unity of ego in sender, du maintenant-écrivain (grasping w/ 1 hand his ballpoint pen) > stigmè of every mark already split

LI.content: “primary masochism” [a wolf of undecidability] poisons, how can one identify the intention, the speaker, the effect once border btwn pleasure/pain is upset?
LI.linkedContent: “primary masochism” [a wolf of undecidability] poisons, how can one identify the intention, the speaker, the effect once border btwn pleasure/pain is upset?

LI.content: thus the limited responsibility of Sarl, vulnerable to parasitisms, the “conscious ego” cannot incorporate and does its best to exclude [despite Derrida’s vehemence, substituting Sarl for Searle demonstrates his uncanny generosity—he will not accuse a subject]
LI.linkedContent: thus the limited responsibility of Sarl, vulnerable to parasitisms, the “conscious ego” cannot incorporate and does its best to exclude [despite Derrida’s vehemence, substituting Sarl for Searle demonstrates his uncanny generosity—he will not accuse a subject]

TN.content: for de Biran, faculty of movement: “willing subject,” twinning (jumeler) the stem (souche): ego w/out ego before ego—1) touch as motor will 2) touch as pure sensibility
TN.linkedContent: for de Biran, faculty of movement: “willing subject,” twinning (jumeler) the stem (souche): ego w/out ego before ego—1) touch as motor will 2) touch as pure sensibility

TN.content: Husserl leads us back to purely psychic ego (Descartes) > not necessarily human
TN.linkedContent: Husserl leads us back to purely psychic ego (Descartes) > not necessarily human

TN.content: “principle of principles” gives us no choice [?]: commands us to begin w/ “us,” that is, w/ most proper, proximate Ego; this “man,” this “we” comes before most radical phenomenological reduction, the one that suspends the world
TN.linkedContent: “principle of principles” gives us no choice [?]: commands us to begin w/ “us,” that is, w/ most proper, proximate Ego; this “man,” this “we” comes before most radical phenomenological reduction, the one that suspends the world

TN.content: for Husserl, introjection is a late, upper layer of experience
TN.linkedContent: for Husserl, introjection is a late, upper layer of experience

TN.content: can there be solipsism w/out introjection? “I” requires intersubjectivity?
TN.linkedContent: can there be solipsism w/out introjection? “I” requires intersubjectivity?

TN.content: the difference Derrida adds to Husserl’s alter-ego: recognize l’irréductible écart even in the touchant-touché de ma “propre” main [there’s alter-ego in my own proper body as human ego]
TN.linkedContent: the difference Derrida adds to Husserl’s alter-ego: recognize l’irréductible écart even in the touchant-touché de ma “propre” main [there’s alter-ego in my own proper body as human ego]

TN.content: intertwining btwn present/nonpresent ensures presence of alter-ego in heart of ego
TN.linkedContent: intertwining btwn present/nonpresent ensures presence of alter-ego in heart of ego

TN.content: when ichfremd [though affirmed] returns to the proper, rebecomes/remains egological
